Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Rabbit neutrophil defensin 3a (NP-3a, CORTICOSTATIN, Arg-rich; natural AMPs; alpha defensin, UCSS1a;  mammals, animals; 3S=S)

Literature Information.Literature: Chemical modification:  Three disulfide bridges.Activity: log deduction after 20 min incubation with 50 ug/ml peptide. Active against S. aureus strains 566, 502A, J.F. (reduction 0-1.3 logs), S. epidermidis UCLA-622 (reduction 1.3 logs), S. pneumoniae Type III (reduction >3.5 log), S. agalactiae Type I-A or III (reduction 0.3-0.6 logs), L. monocytogenes 450 (reduction 0.2 logs), P. aeruginosa PAO579 (reduction 3.3 logs), E. coli ATCC 29648 (reduction 0.6 logs), K. pneumoniae ATCC 13883 (reduction 2.4 logs), S. marcescens (reduction 0.5 log), H. influenzae Type 3A (reduction >1.1 log), B. bronchiseptica UCLA-342 (reduction 0.1 log).Antimicrobial robustness: pH-sensitive:S. agalactiae; pH-sensitive:L. monocytogenes; pH-sensitive:P. aeruginosa; pH-sensitive:P. aeruginosa; NaCl-sensitive:S. agalactiae; NaCl-sensitive:S. agalactiae; NaCl-sensitive:L. monocytogenes; NaCl-sensitive:P. aeruginosa; NaCl-sensitive:K. pneumoniae. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Selsted ME, Brown DM, DeLange RJ, Harwig SS, Lehrer RI.1985
Literature Information.Title: Primary structures of six antimicrobial peptides of rabbit peritoneal neutrophils
